Package fr.inria.lille.shexjava.validation

Class ValidationAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.inria.lille.shexjava.validation.ValidationAlgorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SORBEBasedValidation
    public abstract class ValidationAlgorithm
extends Object

    Allows to validate a graph against a ShEx schema.

    A ValidationAlgorithm must be initialized with an Graph and a ShexSchema. Then the validate(RDFTerm, Label) method allows to construct a shape map of the graph by the schema. The getTyping() method allows to retrieve the shape map constructed by validate(RDFTerm, Label).

    The method validate(RDFTerm, Label) can take as parameter a node and a shape label, which both can be null.

    Author:
    Iovka Boneva, Antonin Durey

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public abstract boolean validate​(org.apache.commons.rdf.api.RDFTerm focusNode,
                                 Label label)
                          throws Exception
        Constructs a shape map that allows to validate a focus node against a type. return true is focusNode has shape label, false otherwise. The constructed shape map can be retrieved using getTyping()
        Parameters:
        focusNode - The focus node for which the shape map is to be complete. If null, then the shape map will be complete for all nodes. The node might not belong to the graph, in which case it does not have a neighborhood.
        label - The label for which the shape map is to be complete. If null, then the shape map will be complete for all labels.
        Throws:
        Exception
